data.name: ChangePlot
data.value: If you'd like to check a new plot, you can click on this button. Your previous plot will go into revision. You can only change plots once every 10 minutes.

data.name: FindTheJaguar1
data.value: There's a lost jaguar somewhere in the land!

data.name: FindTheJaguar2
data.value: We know a little jaguar got lost somewhere.

data.name: FindTheJaguar3
data.value: Be the first to come to his aid and you'll win 5000 points!

data.name: FindTheJaguar7
data.value: Somewhere in the map there's a little jaguar that got lost. To find him, the first thing to do is Zoom in until the jaguar icon (left) turns into binoculars. Then, explore the whole map at that level by dragging. He can be hidden anywhere in the protected area. Find him before other Guardians to rescue him and get the prize!

data.name: Flag1
data.value: Log in to place a flag

data.name: ForestLawCongrats
data.value: Congratulations! You've unlocked the forest protection map accoding to the forest law.

data.name: ForestLawCongrats1
data.value: With this feature you'll be able to see the protected areas according to color. Everything under red doesn't allow any type of deforestation. Forest under yellow permit sustainable usage with no deforestation, and green areas allow greater usage if the right permits are emmited and a public hearing is performed.

data.name: ForestLawCongrats2
data.value: Click here to activate or deactivate this layer.

data.name: Help13
data.value: Every time you log in with a distance of 2hs, you'll get 100 points.

data.name: Help15
data.value: The first time you enter Guardians and finish the tutorial you'll get 2000 points!

data.name: Help17
data.value: For every plot verification you'll get 250 points.

data.name: Help19
data.value: Reporting your plot's status awards 750 points.

data.name: Help21
data.value: When you share your reports or plot verification you'll earn 500 points (up to 10 times a day).

data.name: Help23
data.value: Creating a demand for the authorities awards 1000 points.

data.name: Help25
data.value: For each tree obtained in the games you'll earn 500 points.

data.name: Notifications11
data.value: Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: Notifications12
data.value: You have successfully changed your plot. Are you ready to continue?

data.name: Notifications14
data.value: But don't worry, press the [CONTINUE] button to get a new plot and don't forget to check its status as soon as possible

data.name: Notifications15
data.value: Your plot has been verified 30 times and you've earned 2000 points! Now, it'll go to revision by Greenpeace.Click [Continue] to get a new plot.

data.name: Notifications16
data.value: Your plot has been verified 30 times and you've earned 2000 points! Now, it'll go to revision by Greenpeace.Click [Continue] to get a new plot.

data.name: Notifications5
data.value:
A moderator has checked your alert and confirmed your report.
From now on, you can create a public complaint and send it to the authorities, by clicking on the [Denounce] button
You have earned 500 points!

data.name: Notifications7
data.value: If your plot has clouds over it, you can request a new plot by clicking on the button [Change Plot]

data.name: Notifications9
data.value:
You can only change your plot every 10 minutes, but...
... you can check other plots: Look for green or yellow plots with border and check them.
... you can denonunce verified plots: Look for red plots with border and click [Denounce].
...you can share in Facebook and Twitter your reports.
¡Remember, all this actions gives you points!

data.name: Polls7
data.value: Compare the image on the right with the one from 2008. This helps us validate the reports with more accuracy. When you validate 5 reports, you'll get a score bonus!

data.name: PublishMap1
data.value: Have you seen something interesting? Share it with the world?

data.name: PublishMap3
data.value: URL not yet created, please wait…

data.name: Share1
data.value: I checked my plot in Guardians and it's safe. Help me save the forests of Salta!

data.name: Share2
data.value: My plot is in trouble! Help me verify this to keep Salta's forests safe by joining Guardians. #35milDenuncias

data.name: Timeline1
data.value: you are watching an image from

data.name: Tutorial1
data.value: In this platform, along with other guardians, you'll be in charge of helping enforce the Argentinian National Forest Law in the province of Salta, by monitoring and reporting via updated satellite images any deforestation activity carried out in the period of 2008 to present time.

data.name: Tutorial2
data.value: Do you want to know more?

data.name: Tutorial21
data.value:
To monitor, we will need to compare a recent image to an older one.
Lets see what activity we can find on your plot! CLick here to add a recent image.

data.name: Tutorial22
data.value: Move the slider to see the diference

data.name: Tutorial23
data.value:
When you check your Plot, it is necessary to report what you have seen in order to alert other Guardians.
Click on your Plot and then click on [Report]

data.name: Tutorial24
data.value: You earn points for your actions! You have just received points for checking your plot. Many actions will earn you points,

data.name: Tutorial25
data.value:
Congratulations! You have completed the Tutorial. You are now ready to protect our forests.
Feel free to visit the Help section if you have any doubt.

data.name: Tutorial26
data.value:
Alerted plots are shown in red
Check alerted plots to confirm or reject the report.
Click on the alerted plot and press the CHECK button

data.name: Tutorial27
data.value:
You will be assigned a new plot every 5 days, except if your plot is in alert status. That way, you will be able to monitor other parts of the forest.
You can also manually change your plot by pressing the [Change Plot] button

data.name: Tutorial30
data.value: Every Guardian has a piece of land under his protection. Click on "My Plot" to see yours.

data.name: Tutorial31
data.value: to take a look at your land.

data.name: Tutorial32
data.value:
We Guardians watchout the forest protection laws compliance.
Dragging the slider you will be able to compare an image of 2008 with current images, to help you search for illegal deforestation.

data.name: Tutorial33
data.value:
Great! You have learned how to find changes over time.
You can also add more dates from the list on the left.

data.name: Tutorial35
data.value: This is the map of the area in risk. You can move around using your mouse, panning and zooming.

data.name: Tutorial37
data.value: Set your plot to ALERT status if you see something suspicious. If not, press the button

data.name: Tutorial39
data.value: Plots with Alert status are shown in RED; plots that are ok in GREY

data.name: Tutorial40
data.value: The other Guardians will be able to check their plots and also Your Plot to help you confirm your observations.

data.name: Tutorial41
data.value:
When 40 people have checked your plot, you'll get a new one to lookout for, while the previous one awaits confirmation.
If the observations are confirmed , you'll be able to create a complaint that clearly states the law is not being uphold in that area.
The complaint is your tool!

data.name: Tutorial42
data.value: After checking you will be able to report

data.name: Tutorial45
data.value: if you don't see any problem.

data.name: Tutorial46
data.value: If you see other Guardian Plot in

data.name: Tutorial47
data.value: click over it and then in the [Check] button

data.name: Tutorial48
data.value:
Same as before, here you'll be able to report your observations, helping your Guardian friend to validate his.
The more verifications a plot has, the more the chances to find problems.

data.name: Tutorial50
data.value: Observe the following images. To the left, aerial pictures captured by Greenpeace. To the right, satellite images.

data.name: TutorialGame11
data.value:
The images from the Landsat 7 satellite that we are using have an optical error. In the image you can observe the error lines.
Even with the mentioned error, we can search for deforestation.

data.name: TutorialGame13
data.value:
Ahora que sabes de qué se tratan las imágenes de color real, vamos a ponernos en práctica.
A continuación, buscá en las imagenes las zonas que presenten cambios. Cuantos más aciertos tengas, ¡más puntos vas a ganar!

data.name: TutorialGame15
data.value: Look closely at both images. Can you see changes? Click on the image that shows deforestation.

data.name: TutorialGame5
data.value: Great! You found deforestation. To become an expert, play again to find all the cases and earn additional points!

data.name: TutorialGame6
data.value: Excellent! Now you are an expert in True Color Images!

data.name: TutorialGame7
data.value: You did not get any trees... but don't worry, you can keep on trying anytime you want!

data.name: TutorialGame9
data.value:
Guardianes utiliza imágenes satelitales de diversos proveedores, tomadas periódicamente. En este caso nos enfocaremos en las imagenes de color real del satélite Landsat 7.
Una imagen de color real muestra una representación de la tierra con los colores naturales de cada objeto, como una fotografía normal.
¡Aprendamos a buscar deforestación usando estas imágenes!

data.name: TutorialGameWin1
data.value: Good! You've managed to find deforestation. To be an expert, play again until you go through all the cases!

data.name: TutorialGameWin2
data.value: Don't forget to share with your friends so they too can become Guardians of the forest.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin2
data.value: We want the National Law 26331, also known as 'Forest Law' to be enforced. The law establishes different protection areas by dividing them in colors. Areas in red have total protection, areas in yellow can have sustainable usage and green areas have looser restriction if studies of impact and public hearings have been done. Plots assigned to Guardians fall under the red and yellow categories only.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin4
data.value: Periodically, Greenpeace checks the reports to confirm them. In case of deforestation, the plot is marked in yellow and a complaint can be filed.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin5
data.value: Where do I send my denounces?

data.name: TutorialMenuWin6
data.value: Cuando presionás el botón Enviar en tu denuncia, esta se envía al Gobernador de la Provincia de Salta, y al Secretario de Ambiente de la Nación.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin7
data.value: ¿Puedo enviar una denuncia de forma anónima?

data.name: TutorialMenuWin8
data.value: Si. Debajo de tu nombre en la denuncia hay un botón para hacer que tu denuncia sea anónima.

data.name: AcercaDeCuerpo
data.value:
Guardians is a project from the Greenpeace Argentina Innovation Lab.
The technology in Guardians is developed and inspired in EarthWatchers (www.deforestaction.com/earthwatchers), a Geodan (www.geodan.com) project for DeforestAction.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin10
data.value: My personal information appears in the denounce! I didn't submit them!

data.name: TutorialMenuWin11
data.value: For security and privacy reasons, Guardians do not store personal information of its users. Nevertheless, when you create a denounce we take your data from the petition you signed to save Salta's Forests. If you dont want to submit your personal information in the denounce, select it to be anonymous.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin12
data.value: ¿Why in some cases the colors of the Satellite Images are wrong?

data.name: TutorialMenuWin13
data.value: The satellites we use in Guardians can capture more elements than the human eye. That is why in some cases you can see clouds and other stuff. These can give an irreal aspect to certain areas. In addition, the photographs are taken in different time.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin14
data.value: Where can I see the original images?

data.name: TutorialMenuWin15
data.value: The website from the United States Geological Studies (USGS) contains an archive with all the images captured by the Landsat satellite, the satellite we use in Guardians. For more information visit www.usgs.gov

data.name: TutorialMenuWin16
data.value: I don't understand if what I am seeing in my plot is deforestation

data.name: TutorialMenuWin17
data.value: In these cases we recommend you two possible courses of action. You can visit the Help Menu and play the MiniGame I. Playing the MiniGame will help you to better understand what is deforestation and what is not. Or, you can press the Change Plot button to move you to other area.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin18
data.value: A Jaguar have just appeared, what is this?

data.name: TutorialMenuWin19
data.value: When you see a message telling you that a Jaguar is present in the map, this means that a competition among all Guardians to Find the Jaguar has started. In some area of the map, at a certain zoom level (when you achieve the appropiate zoom level you will see a binocular icon instead of the jaguar icon), you will be able to find a tiny Jaguar. If you see it, click fast over it to rescue it! The first Guardian who finds it will be awarded a great bunch of points.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin20
data.value: When does the Denounce button become enabled?

data.name: TutorialMenuWin21
data.value: When your plot has 30 or more verifications, the Greenpeace user will become its owner till one of our experts verify your report. We will send you an email with the result of our verification. If you don't receive this email, check if your email address is correct. If your plot now appears with a yellow border you will now be able to create a denounce.

data.name: TutorialMenuWin22
data.value: There is deforestation in the 2008 image. Do I have to report this as well?

data.name: TutorialMenuWin23
data.value: No, you do not have to report this.

data.name: TutorialMiniGame2
data.value:
Welcome! In this game you'll be able to train your eye for deforestation hunting, in order to visualize correctly a healthy plot of land from one that's been suffering the effect of the bulldozers.
The more trained you are, the more accurate your reports will be. The forest needs you!

data.name: TutorialMiniGame4
data.value: Select the image that shows deforestation

data.name: TutorialMiniGame5
data.value: Right now, there are no images to play. Try again later. Thanks!

data.name: TutorialMiniGame7
data.value: Good! You've managed to find deforestation. To be an expert, play again until you go through all the cases!

data.name: TutorialMiniGame9
data.value: points in the find-the-deforestation game in Guardians! You can be a Guardian too, register at guardianes.greenpeace.org.ar

data.name: MailBienvenidaTitulo
data.value: Ya estás protegiendo los bósques de Salta!

data.name: MailBienvenidaCuerpo
data.value:
Para Comenzar a jugar apretá el botón de abajo!

Tips para Jugar
  • Podés obtener una nueva parcela apretando [Cambiar Parcela]
  • Comentá en las parcelas de los demás para ayudarlos con sus reportes
  • Completá todos los tutoriales y jugá los minijuegos
  • Entrá varias veces al dia para obtener mas puntos

data.name: MailBienvenidaBotonTooltip
data.value: Click here to start protecting the forest
